result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mickeal R. Howard Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mickeal R. Howard in court with attorney Cana G Kohn.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CM266 & 16CM97  @ 11:18 am.  State gives plea agreement, Guilty 15Cm266 ct 1, ct 2 DRI, 16CM97 DRI, withheld sentence 1 year probation, AODA and follow through and costs. Atty Kohn and def. agrees with plea agreement. Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed. Def. understands charge and penalties.  15CM266 Ct 1 Obstructing no contest plea, DRI ct 2 and 16CM97.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements.  Atty Kohn is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given.  Stipulate to factual basis. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to Obstructing.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Atty Kohn gives sentencing recommendation.  Def. has nothing to say.  Court accepts plea agreement and orders in 15CM266 ct 1 withheld sentence 1 year probation, AODA and follow through with recommendations, Court questions driver safety plan, Def. makes statement.  Court will not order that condition, costs, DNA Sample & $200 surcharge, Credit for 1 day credit if revoked.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights. Def. ask if can costs can be added to pp.  Court explains probation will collect.

ADDRESS INFO for Mickeal R. Howard Jr.
Current: 132 E 8th Ave, Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 05-10-2016)
Prior: 933 6th Ave Apt 103, Antigo, WI 54409
